1494315876870414343.text: In October, the Senate passed Sen. @ossoff’s bipartisan Prison Camera Reform Act of 2021, which will require BOP to ensure all correctional facilities have the security camera coverage necessary to protect the civil rights and safety of incarcerated people & staff.

1494315875364651009.text: Earlier this month, Sens. @ossoff & Braun joined @LeaderMcConnell & Sens. @RandPaul, @SenatorSinema, & @SenMikeLee to introduce legislation that would increase Federal oversight & accountability of the Federal prison system by making the BOP Director a Senate-confirmed position.

1494315873888354304.text: “Indiana is home to the Federal Corrections Complex in Terre Haute, and I am glad to form this group with Senator @ossoff to work on bipartisan ideas to improve the safety and well-being of Bureau of Prisons staff and incarcerated individuals,” @SenatorBraun said.

1494315872479072258.text: “America’s prisons and jails are horrifically dysfunctional and too often places where brutality and criminality are prevalent. The Senate Bipartisan Prison Policy Working Group will identify and advance solutions,” Sen. @ossoff said.

1494315870931271683.text: The group will aim to improve the safety and well-being of incarcerated people and staff, reduce recidivism rates, and promote transparency within the prison system.

1494315869454974977.text: The Senate Bipartisan Prison Policy Working Group will work to develop bipartisan policies and proposals to strengthen oversight of the federal prison system and improve communication between the Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP), Congress, and other stakeholders.

1494315867743608833.text:
NEW: Sen. @ossoff and @SenatorBraun today launched the bipartisan Senate Prison Policy Working Group to examine conditions of incarceration in U.S. Federal prisons, protect human rights, and promote transparency.

https://t.co/CvFhj8jYf9

1493340705124753410.text: “For nearly 50 years, the federal government and the City of Tybee Island have been partnering on the Tybee Island Beach Erosion Control Project to make sure residents and visitors are able to enjoy the island for years to come," @SenatorWarnock continued.

1493340703363108871.text: “Regular renourishment of the City of Tybee Island’s beach is crucial for protecting Tybee Island’s economy and the safety of its residents from damage due to storm surges and coastal flooding,” said @SenatorWarnock.

1493340701555413001.text: “This bill will help protect the beautiful Tybee Island as part of my ongoing effort to support, protect, and invest in coastal Georgia,” Sen. @ossoff said.

1493340699827310595.text:
Tybee Island has been one of the most prominent tourist destinations in the state of Georgia since the 1870s and has experienced 10 inches of sea level rise since 1935.

The bill will ensure the Island can continue to implement coastal storm risk management projects.

1493340697939820544.text: The Tybee Island Storm Risk Management Act will ensure Tybee Island has the resources it needs to protect from sea level rise, storm surge, coastal flooding, and other impacts of climate change.

"Jon @ossoff wants to ban stock trading in Congress. It’s long overdue."

https://t.co/YGASjxkGzl

1490790857645166601.text: 76 percent of Americans agree: it's time to ban stock trading by members of Congress.

1490770512426975241.text: “I don’t believe members of Congress should be taking the information they have and trading stocks to enrich themselves while making public policy. It’s our job to serve the people, not ourselves.” -@SenatorBaldwin

1490770511084896270.text: “There is an inherent conflict of interest for Members of Congress who have access to info impacting the stock market that isn't available to the general public ... This legislation will prevent potential conflicts of interest & strengthen public trust in our govt."-@SenStabenow

1490770509742682114.text: “The American people need to know that their elected leaders are putting their constituents’ interests — not their own financial interests — first,” @SenGillibrand said. “That is the job we were sent to Washington to do."

1490770508454973451.text: “Simply put, Senators and members of Congress shouldn’t be using insider knowledge to make money in the stock market. Their stock portfolios should not be driving their policymaking, & we need to avoid even the slightest suggestion that this might be the case,” said @PattyMurray.

1490770507133857795.text: “Members of Congress shouldn’t trade individual stocks – plain and simple,” said @MartinHeinrich. “I’m proud to cosponsor this common-sense legislation that makes sure Congress prioritizes people over personal gain.”

1490770505678434315.text: “People should always come before profits. The Ban Congressional Stock Trading Act is an important step to ensure lawmakers are focused on bettering the lives of the people they represent, not bettering their bank accounts,” said @SenatorWarnock.

1490770504378167302.text: “Since I took office, I’ve been focused on bringing more accountability and transparency to Congress so this place can actually work for Arizonans. I’m glad our legislation to clean up Washington is gaining momentum and support," said @SenMarkKelly.

1490770502994046981.text: “Members of Congress have extraordinary access to privileged information, and we make federal policy,” Sen. @ossoff said. “We shouldn’t be trading stocks or permitted to trade stocks while we do so.”

1490767749928439819.text:
Momentum continues to build for Sen. @ossoff & @SenMarkKelly's legislation to ban Congressional stock trading.

A growing coalition of Senators have now signed on: @SenatorWarnock, @PattyMurray, @SenStabenow, @SenatorBaldwin, @MartinHeinrich, @SenBrianSchatz, @SenGillibrand.

WATCH: Sen. @Ossoff tells the story of meeting the caregiver of an 87-year-old Georgian who had to wait hours to vote.

His "Voters' Access to Water Act" would allow a nonpartisan, good Samaritan volunteer to offer her a bottle of water without fear of *criminal prosecution.* https://t.co/3wwxA43XI3

1392161877283811328.text:
“It is our obligation as federal legislators to safeguard the bedrock of our democracy, which is the sacred right to vote.” -Sen. @ossoff.

#ForthePeopleAct https://t.co/k8LjnP3TJD

1392154032567984145.text: @thetrevorpotter, president of @CampaignLegal, said “It is basic decency to allow voters to receive water from nonpartisan volunteers ... Senator @ossoff’s bill would protect voters in line from being forced to choose between their right to vote & their fundamental human needs."

1392154031309660167.text: “As we waited in line for hours, through the rain, we were appreciative of the kind volunteers offering all of us something to drink,” Zwang said. “We saw some voters leave because of the long lines, but the offer of something to drink helped many of us wait.”

1392154030072287233.text:
Jason Zwang & his wife, who live in Peoplestown, waited a combined 7 hours to vote. While waiting, nonpartisan vols offered them water & food while standing in line on a hot, rainy day.

Under SB 202, vols could face up to a year in prison for trying to offer a bottle of water.

1392154028788920332.text: “No voter should be made to wait hours in line to vote,” Cottman said. “But when long lines happen, all voters deserve access to water while they wait. To criminalize that is outrageous — and I’m grateful to Senator @ossoff and @SenatorWarnock for introducing this bill.”

1392154027555790848.text:
Aiyana Cottman, from Atlanta, waited nearly four hours to vote in 2020.

While waiting, she saw nonpartisan volunteers offering water to those who were waiting, and her experience that day inspired her to sign-up to be a poll worker.

1392154026255474692.text: "Fair Fight Action is proud to support this legislation, and I am proud that Georgia's Democratic Congressional delegation is leading to protect access to the ballot box for all eligible Americans,” said @staceyabrams, Founder of @fairfightaction.

1392154024976125954.text: “The Voters’ Access to Water Act gets us closer to that goal, and I’m proud to work with Senator @ossoff to get this important legislation, along with the critical For the People Act, over the finish line," @SenatorWarnock continued.

1392154023688646656.text: “Voting rights are preservative of all other rights. We must do everything in our power to expand access to the ballot box, and eliminate any and all barriers that will make it harder for voters in Georgia and nationwide to make their voices heard,” @SenatorWarnock said.

1392154022367354885.text: “Georgia voters are often made to wait hours in line to vote. This bill will ensure a nonpartisan, Good Samaritan volunteer can offer voters in line a bottle of water without fear of criminal prosecution,” Sen. @ossoff said while introducing the legislation.

1392154021172064270.text: The "Voters’ Access to Water Act" would prohibit states from banning the provision of food or water to voters waiting in line — as long as volunteers do not engage in campaigning or political activity — and as long as water or food are offered to every voter in line.

1392154019481767943.text:
Yesterday, Sen. @ossoff & @SenatorWarnock officially introduced the "Voters' Access to Water Act," which protects voters’ access to water when they are made to wait in line outside polling places.

This is in response to GA SB 202, which *criminalizes* offering voters water. https://t.co/3PJoAi3T6D

1370384180748693516.text: 📞💻 Georgians with questions should contact our office https://t.co/YnqkbzwZU4

1370383643177271300.text: For tax returns with direct deposit or bank account information, the IRS will be able to send money electronically. For those households for which Treasury cannot determine a bank account, paper checks or debit cards will be sent.

1370383562411802635.text: For households that haven’t yet filed for 2020, the IRS will review records from 2019 to determine eligibility and amount of payment. That includes those who used the “non-filer portal” for previous rounds of payments.

1370383425471909888.text: For individuals and households who have already filed their income tax return for 2020, the IRS will use that information to determine eligibility and size of your payments.

1370383230935965700.text:
👨‍👦‍👦Individuals making up to $75,000 and couples making up to $150,000 will receive a child tax credit.
 
💸Families will receive a $3,600 tax credit for each child under 6 and $3,000 for each child between the age of 6 and 16.

1370382963171549189.text:
🙍🏽 Individual tax filers making up to $75,000 per year will get $1,400. 

👩🏾‍🤝‍👨🏼Couples, who file their taxes jointly, making up to $150,000 will get $2,800. 

👨‍👨‍👧There will also be $1,400 tacked on for each dependent in the household.

1370382735592816642.text: What you need to know about the direct payments in the American Rescue Plan ⬇️
